outputs.output_descr:
This project aims at providing operational and logistic support to the Office of the Quartet Representative  OQR Team  Office of Mr. Tony Blair -and staff based in Jerusalem, so as to enable the effective and quick implementation of the Quartet objectives. Allocated funds shall be utilized to cover operational, logistics and other activities of an enabling nature vis-à-vis the Quartet Representative's Mission and Team.

In particular, the project will ensure a) procurement of goods, works, services and expertise; b) project management services; c) fund management services; d) Asset management services; e) personnel recruitment and broader human resources management services; f) logistical and administrative support; g) financial support services; h) project management related financial and substantive reporting.

outputs.output_descr:
This project aims at providing operational and logistic support to the Office of the Quartet Representative  OQR Team  Office of Mr. Tony Blair -and staff based in Jerusalem, so as to enable the effective and quick implementation of the Quartet objectives. Allocated funds shall be utilized to cover operational, logistics and other activities of an enabling nature vis-à-vis the Quartet Representative's Mission and Team.

In particular, the project will ensure a) procurement of goods, works, services and expertise; b) project management services; c) fund management services; d) Asset management services; e) personnel recruitment and broader human resources management services; f) logistical and administrative support; g) financial support services; h) project management related financial and substantive reporting.

The project will provide Operational and Logistical support to the OQR by providing finance, procurment, travel, human resources, and logistical support.



Project Objectives, Detailed Discription and Outcomes: 
Project Objectives:
•	Mobilize international assistance to the Palestinians, working closely with donors and existing coordination bodies 
•	Help to identify, and secure appropriate international support in addressing the institutional governance needs of the Palestinian state, focusing as a matter of urgency on the rule of law 
•	Develop plans to promote Palestinian economic development, including private sector partnerships, building on previously agreed frameworks, especially concerning access and movement and 
•	Liaise with other countries as appropriate in support of the agreed Quartet objectives



The Quartet (United Nations, Russian Federation, United States and the European Union) principals noted that recent events in Gaza and the West Bank make it more urgent than ever that the search for peace in the Middle East evolves and human security increases.  The Quartet reaffirms its objective to promote an end to the conflict between Israelis and Palestinians in conformity with the Road Map, and expresses its intention to redouble its efforts in that regard.  The urgency of recent events has reinforced the need for the international community, bearing in mind the obligations of the parties, to help Palestinians as they build the institutions and economy of a viable State in Gaza and the West Bank, able to take its place as a peaceful and prosperous partner to Israel and its other neighbors. To facilitate efforts to these ends, following discussions among the principals, the Quartet announced the appointment of the Rt. Hon. Mr. Tony Blair (United Kingdom) as the Quartet Representative.

Expected Project Output/Outcome:
Continue to provide operational and logistical support to OQR during its mandate until Jan 2011.  Support includes premises, personnel, procurement services, financial services, and transportation.

The project mains covers operational and logistical support to the Rule of Law Project and team.
